Key: (Maria and I just left the house in our uniforms.)

(...This feels so strange. To be able to walk to school
with Maria like I did back then.)

(Just as I thought that, Maria—who was swiftly walking
in front of me—suddenly turned around.)
What's the matter, Shido?

Oh... Nothing in particular. Uh, how do I say this...
You look like you're having fun, Maria.

Oh... right... Maybe I was in too good of a mood.
Considering our current situation, it's proof that I'm
not being careful enough. Sorry, Shido...

Oh, no, no. I wasn't trying to criticize you, Maria.
I think it's fine that you're like this.
...Really?

Yeah, of course. I'm happier to see you acting natural,
Maria.
I knew you'd say that.

Does it make you happy to go to school in your
uniform?

Yes. Actually, wearing this uniform, I feel like a real
member of Raizen High School.

(She's right. In the virtual world, Maria wasn't
wearing a uniform. Nobody ever questioned it, so she
didn't have to wear it, but...)
I suppose I've made a bit of a mistake.
Haha. You don't look like you think that at all.

Ah, you've caught on! You're really sharp, Shido.
It may be Marina's influence.
I see... Maybe...

(Marina disappeared and left Maria behind. Unlike
Maria, Marina was more teasing in the manner that
she spoke.)
Oh...

(If Maria's here, does that mean maybe Marina's
somewhere around, too? I'm sure that Marina
disappeared back then.)

(But if it's this abnormal world, maybe... I keep getting
split seconds of hope like that. And besides―)

(Besides...? Besides what? The words that came to
mind spun around in my head.)

(What was I thinking right now? If Maria's here, who
was it that would've been here, too? Wait, besides
that was―)
Shido? You stopped walking. Is something wrong?
Oh, sorry! I―
Shido!

(The moment that someone called for me from behind...
I felt like I knew the voice, it sounded so familiar.)

(I remember... No, I don't. I remember. No, I don't.
For some reason I had this sense that my memories
and consciousness weren't matching up.)
Shido!
(This voice!)

(Is this what it means when your mind goes blank?
I was so detached that I was conscious of it. But this
soft voice, those kind eyes... She's...)
Rin...ne?

(When I called out to her, she softly nodded in my
arms.)

(I felt myself hold onto her even more tightly. If I
squeezed too hard, would she just pass through me
like a phantom...?)
Are you... really Rinne?

(In response, I definitely felt her. A nostalgic feeling―
her warmth.)
Yeah... I'm Rinne... Rinne Sonogami. Shido...

(The moment I acknowledged it, something inside me
overflowed. The memories of early summer. Joy,
sorrow, pain, anger―all these emotions came over me.)

(And eventually, one of them stood out over the rest.
Rinne Sonogami... a special person, my former
childhood friend".)"

(We had a sad separation, and I wasn't supposed to
be able to see her again... or so I thought.)
I don't believe it... You're here, Rinne.

I'm thinking the exact same thing, Shido.
I'm wondering how I could be here.

But there's another part of me that thinks none of it
matters... Is that terrible of me?
Not at all... I'm thinking the same thing...
I'm so happy... You haven't changed at all, Shido.
Right back at you. You're the same old Rinne.
Hahaha... Maybe we're similar.
We are childhood friends, after all.
...Yeah, we are childhood friends.
Oh! Rinne! It's been a while, I was worried about you!

Rinne-oneechan, welcome back! So it was today that
you were coming back.

Tohka-chan, Kotori-chan...! It's been a while, how
have you guys been?
Yeah! I've been really well!
I've been good, too! How about you, Rinne-oneechan?
I... Hmm. I guess I missed you guys so much.
Oh, I'm going to go call Yoshino and the others!
Right, good idea! We will leave it to you, Kotori!
Kotori-chan, don't run so fast! It's dangerous!
I'm fine!
Wh-What's going on...?

(Everyone is totally fine with Rinne being here... Isn't
this weird?)
She's the only one who can answer that.
M-Maria?! Y-You were here...
I see how it is. You were here," huh... Who's the one

Operator: who ignored me, being all lovey-dovey with his

Key: Oh, um... Maria-san? Are you upset?
I'm not upset at all. ♪
AHHHH!
(Sh-She's not the Maria I know!)

...Oh, sorry Shido. I'm supposed to be living alone,
and I guess the setting is that I've been visiting my
parents.
I see... I get it now.

(Rinne came near me and whispered into my ear. I felt
like Maria was pouting even more next to me, but it
must be my imagination... Or at least, I hope it is.)

Hey... Shido, Rinne. Are you guys telling each other
secrets?

N-Not at all, Tohka. We were talking about dinner
tonight.

That's right, Tohka-chan. It's been a while, so we
were discussing what kind of special food we could
prepare.

I see! Your cooking is amazing, Rinne! I'm getting
excited!
Hey, I brought them over!
Rinne-san... Good morning. I'm happy... you're back...
Ya-hooo! It's been a while, Rinne-chaaan!

Hehe... Rinne. Finally you've returned from your
journey of salvation. Thanks to your efforts, it seems
as though the miasma of darkness has been lifted...
Joy. I'm glad nothing happened.
(Hm? Kaguya and Yuzuru―)

Hehe. Congratulations, Rinne-san! We missed you so
much.
Thanks, everyone. I'm happy to be back.
(...Miku, too? Wait could this be—)
...Is that what it means?

...I think so. I too have memories of spending time with
Kaguya-chan, Yuzuru-chan, and Miku-san.

(Rinne answered my mutterings. I think I'm especially
happy because Rinne has naturally fit in with the rest
of the group.)
I know! Why don't we celebrate Rinne's return?

Oh, that's a nice idea, Tohka-san! We should have a
party or something with a buffet....
Buffet... Hey, we don't have that much space.

Then why don't we do teppanyaki? Then we can all
gather around the pan and cook!

I see. That seems doable. We all cook things we like
and enjoy one another's presence.

Oh, teppanyaki! That's a great idea. Meat, fish,
vegetables... We can cook anything, right? I'm very
excited!

That's true, but... I don't know if you're supposed to
just cook anything...

No, I think it'll be fun for all of us to be together. We
can all bring food in, kind of like a mystery pot...? Of
course be sure to prepare things we can eat, okay?
Oh, good idea. Let's do that.

(Well it's not like we'll use the things they bring
directly. It'll be fun.)

AH! You guys are chatting too much! We'd better hurry
or else!

Kotori is right. If we walk too slowly, we may miss
homeroom.
Alright. Then let's head out.
I'm that way!

Oh... I'm going to go home, too. I will see everyone
later... Um, the party... I look forward to it, too.
Yeah, totally, I can't wait. Yoshinon is so excited!
Yeah. I'll see you later.

Then let's go, everyone! To be late to the party would
taint the Yamai name.

Agreed. However, Yuzuru will be the first through the
gate.
Run, run, run―
H-Hey, Yuzuru?! Wait a minute!

Let us go Tohka, my kin!
We must not allow Yuzuru to be first.
U-Understood!
Oh, you guys! Don't leave me behind!
Hey, you guys, don't―And there they go.

(Hm... Wait, Miku's heading that way, too. Does that
mean she's attending Raizen High School like Maria?
Her uniform still seems to be her old one, though...)

(Well she went ahead, so there's nothing I can do.
At this rate, it'll be a lot of people.)

And besides, we left early. We don't have to rush too
much...
...I wonder if everyone was looking out.
Hm? Did you say something?
...No, nothing. We should go too.
Yeah.
...*Stare*.

(Maria is staring at me. That's right, this is the only
time I can check with Rinne about what's going on
without Tohka and the others noticing.)
...Rinne, can I ask you one thing?
...I don't know.
What...?!

You want to ask me about this, right? A world where
there's no way I would exist... Is this place Eden...?
(I gulped. She nailed it. I was about to ask that.)

(Maria doesn't have a body. Rinne, who should have
disappeared. And a fake memory implanted in
everyone's minds as if there's something to hide.)
(I remember this twisted world.)

(That summer, Rinne activated this infinitely looping
world, Eden. Unfortunately... there's no way that this
isn't related.)
It's a strange feeling. I know that we're inside Eden.
And I recognize myself as Rinne Sonogami". But I'm

Operator: not the Ruler of this world... That, I'm sure of."

Key: You're not the "Ruler"...?

Shido, you may not be able to believe me. But I have
no powers right now. I can't create an ideal world for
you, nor can I send you back.

To put it frankly, I'm like an empty shell. I lost
everything, and I am all that's left.
Rinne...

Sorry, Shido. I can't do anything for you. I'm sure
that... all of this is my fault.

Well, we don't know that. And besides, don't say you
can't do anything for me.
Shido...

I'm just happy you're by my side, Rinne. I told you,
didn't I? That we can start over. Maybe now's the
time.

...This time, it's a promise. Although I don't know what
might happen next.
...Thanks, Shido. I'm... so happy.
(I gently took Rinne's hand.)
...I see. Rinne Sonogami, I understand the situation.
M-Maria?!

(I was seriously surprised... Maria had been standing
between Rinne and myself before we knew it.)

Nice to meet you. I'm Rinne Sonogami. You must be...
Maria Arusu-san, right?
Please call me Maria.
Oh, okay. Um, can it be Maria-chan?
Yes. That is not a problem.

Thanks. Um, the Maria-chan in my memory is a half-
Japanese girl who lives overseas... and has come to
do a homestay here. But that's not true. Right?

(Maria looked at me for a split second. She must be
checking to see if it's okay for her to say so. I looked
her in the eyes and softly nodded.)

...That would be the case, I am artificial intelligence
born of the Fraxinus. Although I have a personality
similar to that of a human, I am not real.

I-I'm so sorry! I didn't mean for it to come out like
that! I'm so sorry for saying something that could
have hurt you...
Rinne Sonogami... You're a kind person.

That's not true at all. But someone who's even nicer
taught me.
Is it... that person?

Yes. *giggle*... It's exactly who you think it is,
Maria-chan.
I see. Heh...
Um... Who are you guys talking about?
That is none of your... Well it kind of is, huh?

Right. It may have something to do with you, but
maybe not.
(That makes me even more curious...)

Anyways, I can now deduce the situation based on your
conversation. The Angel called Eden, or someone with
similar powers, may be the key to this phenomenon.

You're right, Maria. That's very likely. I feel like it's
similar to your case, but...

No. I know for certain that this isn't virtual reality.
However, it's true that we are in an abnormal situation.
In order to resolve it, we need more information.

(But what can we do to resolve it? I don't even know
what that is. Not that it's a good enough reason to do
nothing.)

But... When you say gather information, what do you
mean?

First, we're going to have to live our normal lives. We
need to see what's going on in the world. Of course,
within a range that doesn't disturb our daily lives.

I see... You have a point. It wouldn't be the first time
we used this approach. There were hints about what
was going on in our daily lives.

Right. As we continue to live our lives here, we should
be able to catch on to the intention behind all this.
Someone may contact us like Marina did.

Right. I agree with Maria-chan. I have a feeling that
you'll be the one who'll find the answer, Shido.
What a coincidence. I agree with you, Rinne Sonogami.

*Giggle*... You too, huh Maria-chan? Oh... Call me
Rinne, Maria-chan. It feels too formal, you know?
Understood. Then I will call you Rinne from now on.
Okay! It's a pleasure, Maria-chan.
The pleasure is mine, Rinne.

(Seeing them call each other by name made me tear up
a bit. The two who should have disappeared have met,
and can now be friends. It really feels like a dream.)

(Suddenly I felt a pang of pain in my heart. If Eden is
a fake world like the other one, someday it will
disappear.)
